content: row 7 using c2 k2 sl 1 wyib k3 to 3 sts before end sl 1 wyib k2 row 8 using c2 k2 sl 1 wyif k3 to 3 sts before end sl 1 wyif k2 row 9 using c3 k row 10 using c3 k2 p to 2 sts before end k2 row 11 using c2 k4 sl 1 wyib k3 to 5 sts before end sl 1 wyib k4 row 12 using c2 k4 sl 1 wyif k3 to 5 sts before end sl 1 wyif k4 row 13 using c3 k row 14 using c3 k2 p to 2 sts before end k2 work row 7-14 a total of 5 times repeat row 7-8 one more time then break c2 row 49 using c3 k row 50 p row 51-54 using c3 p bind off all sts as if to purl leaving a tail approx 51 cm / 20 in long and proceed to fnishing instructions 7 colorblock dishcloth using c2 cast on 36 sts row 1-6 k row 7 k row 8 k5 p to 5 sts before end k5 work row 7-8 a total of 5 times cut c2 and join c1 work row 7-8 in c1 a total of 10 times cut c1 and join c3 work row 7-8 in c3 a total of 5 times row 47-52 k bind off all sts leaving a tail approx 51 cm / 20 in long and proceed to fnishing instructions © alanna penk 2021 finishing all dishcloths making a loop to hang it up optional create a series of slipknots this is also called fnger knitting approx 5-7 5 cm / 2-3 inches long pulling the last slipknot all the way through to secure then thread onto tapestry needle and secure the slipknot chain to the corner of dishcloth forming a loop and weave in both ends this loop is handy for hanging your dishcloths on hooks- feel free to skip if you do not wish to have a loop blocking blocking your dishcloths is optional but can make them look nice and polished especially for gifting block as follows soak in lukewarm water with wool wash then rinse and squeeze out all water pin to blocking mats in a nice even square and leave it fat to dry for pattern support contact alanna@blackcatknitco com www blackcatknitco com ravelry blackcatknitco instagram blackcatknitco © alanna penk 2021 © alanna penk 2021
